parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.
A gathering (collecting) together, assembling. From episunago; a complete collection; especially a Christian meeting.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A custom, habit; an institute, rite. From etho; a usage.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
